newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's Bankar to join Postabank cap hike.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's Bankar to join Postabank cap hike.

text.p: Hungary's Bankar financial group said on Monday it would like to participate in a planned capital increase in the country's second largest commercial bank, Postabank.
"It cannot be excluded that a consortium of foreign investors could be found to whom Bankar can provide value," Bankar's Chief Executive, Gabor Kovacs told a news conference.
On Friday Postabank's shareholders cleared the management of responsibility for a recent panic withdrawal by depositors and approved capital hikes worth 20 billion forints ($109.6 million).
Postabank will invite 22 investors, including four companies belonging to the Bankar group, to raise the bank's capital by five to 10 billion forints on June 23 and June 24.
Postabank had earlier commissioned SBC Warburg to invite foreign investors to raise the bank's capital by a further 10 billion forints, in September or October.
The bank plans to float its shares on the Budapest Stock Exchange following the capital increases.

Postabank was hit by a wave of deposit withdrawals worth some 24 billion forints at the end of February and police are investigating the case currently after the bank said the panic was likely to have been triggered by organised rumours.
